auths_ttl.description: TTL for cached auths in seconds

description: This policy caches authorizations from the 3scale backend
and reports them in batches. This is more efficient than authorizing
and reporting on each request at the expense of losing accuracy in the
rate limits.
3scale_batcher.name: 3scale Batcher
3scale_batcher.summary: Caches auths from 3scale backend and batches reports.

3scale_referrer.description: Sends the 'Referer' to 3scale backend for validation.
3scale_referrer.name: 3scale Referrer
3scale_referrer.summary: Sends the 'Referer' to 3scale backend so it can be validated.

description: Main functionality of APIcast to work with the 3scale API
manager. This includes matching of mapping rules, authorization,
reporting, etc.
apicast.name: 3scale APIcast
apicast.summary: Main functionality of APIcast to work with the 3scale API manager.

oneOf.title: Resilient: authorize according to last request when backend is down.
Allow: when backend is down, allow everything unless seen before and denied.

description: Configures a cache for the authentication calls against the 3scale
backend. This policy supports four kinds of caching:
- Strict: it only caches authorized calls. Denied and failed calls
invalidate the cache entry.
- Resilient: caches authorized and denied calls. Failed calls do not
invalidate the cache. This allows APIcast to authorize and deny calls
according to the result of the last request made even when backend is
down.
- Allow: caches authorized and denied calls. When backend is
unavailable, it will cache an authorization. In practice, this means
that when backend is down _any_ request will be authorized unless last
call to backend for that request returned 'deny' (status code = 4xx).
Make sure to understand the implications of this Caching mode before
using it.
- None: disables caching.
caching.name: 3scale Auth Caching
caching.summary: Controls how to cache authorizations returned by the 3scale backend.

all_proxy.description: Defines a HTTP proxy to be used for connecting to services if a protocol-specific proxy is not specified. Authentication is not supported.

http_proxy.description: Defines a HTTP proxy to be used for connecting to HTTP services. Authentication is not supported

https_proxy.description: Defines a HTTPS proxy to be used for connecting to HTTPS services. Authentication is not supported

description: With this policy all the traffic for this service will be routed accross
the defined proxy
camel.name: Camel Service
camel.summary: Adds an Camel proxy to the service.

op.description: Operation to apply. The matches op supports PCRE (Perl compatible regular expressions)

header.description: Header name to return with the cache status (HIT, MISS,EXPIRED)
header.title: Header name

description: With this policy a new way to enable caching in APICast is enabled based on any Liquid filter operation
content_caching.name: Content caching
content_caching.summary: Option to enable content caching on responses.

allow_credentials.description: Whether the request can be made using credentials

allow_origin.description: Origin allowed for CORS requests. The field expects only one origin (e.g. 'https://example.com') or '*'. If left blank, the value of the 'Origin' request header will be used. In order to allow more than one origin it is possible to use a regular expression, if it matches with Origin header value, the value will be set to the Origin Value. In case it does not match, the header will not set at all. Example: '(api|web).test.com' wil match both 'api.test.com' and 'web.test.com'.

max_age.description: The ttl of the preflight response (default: 600)

description: This policy enables Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) request
handling. It allows to define CORS headers such as
Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Access-Control-Allow-Methods, etc.
When combined with the APIcast policy, the CORS policy should be
placed before it in the chain.
cors.name: CORS Request Handling
cors.summary: Enables CORS (Cross Origin Resource Sharing) request handling.

increment.description: How many hits should be incremented, liquid value
increment.title: Increment

metric.description: Metric name to increment in case of condition match (liquid input)
metric.title: Metric to increment

op.description: Operation to apply. The matches op supports PCRE (Perl compatible regular expressions)

description: With this policy, on post_actions the Authrep call will report any new
metric if one of the conditions match. The main use case for this is to
report any metric based on response headers, status codes, or any other
liquid exposed variable.
custom_metrics.name: Custom Metrics
custom_metrics.summary: Custom metrics on Nginx post actions

description:
This policy allows service exposure without authentication. 
It can be useful, for example, for legacy apps that cannot be adapted to 
send the auth params. 
When the credentials are not provided in the request, this policy 
provides the default ones configured. 
You need to configure a user_key; or, the combination of app_id + app_key. 
Note: this policy should be placed before the APIcast policy in the chain.
default_credentials.name: Anonymous Access
default_credentials.summary: Provides default credentials for unauthenticated requests.

oneOf.title: Interrupt the processing of the request.

status.description: HTTP status code to be returned

description: This policy prints the request back to the client and optionally sets
a status code.
echo.name: Echo
echo.summary: Prints the request back to the client and optionally sets a status code.

validate_oauth2_certificate_bound_access.description: Validate OAuth 2.0 Mutual TLS Certificate Bound access token. If enable, all tokens are verified and must contain the certificate hash claim (cnf). If the verification fails, the request will be rejected with 401.
validate_oauth2_certificate_bound_access.title: Validate OAuth 2.0 Mutual TLS Certificate Bound access token

validate_x_fapi_customer_ip_address.description: Validate x-fapi-customer-ip-address header. If the verification fails, the request will be rejected with 403

ranges (like 172.18.0.0/16) can be used.

description: This is a policy intended only for debugging purposes. This policy
returns the context available when evaluating liquid. Any policy can
modify the context that is shared between policies and that context is
available when evaluating liquid. However, documenting what is available
is not possible because policies can add any arbitrary field. Users who
want to develop a policy can use this one to know the context available
in their configuration.
When combined with the APIcast policy or the upstream one, this policy
needs to be placed before them in the chain in order to work correctly.
Note: This policy only returns duplicated objects once to avoid circular
references.
liquid_context_debug.name: Liquid Context Debug

It allows to select a list of Upstream URLs for which to enable the maintenance mode.

description: Captures arguments in a URL and rewrites the URL using these arguments.
For example, we can specify a matching rule with arguments like
'/{orderId}/{accountId}' and a template that specifies how to rewrite
the URL using those arguments. Example:
'/sales/v2/{orderId}?account={accountId}'; in this case, the request
'/123/456' will be transformed into '/sales/v2/123?account=456'
rewrite_url_captures.name: URL Rewriting with Captures
rewrite_url_captures.summary: Captures arguments in a URL and rewrites the URL using them.

rules.description: List of rules to be applied

combine_op.description: With 'and', the condition will be true only when all the operations evaluate to true. With 'or', the condition will be true when at least one operation evaluates to true.

host_header.description: Host for the Host header. When not specified, defaults to the host of the URL.

owner_id.description: Value to only increment hits on the mapping rules owner by the same id.

replace_path.description: Liquid filter to modify the request path to the matched Upstream URL. When no specified, keep the original path

description: This policy allows to modify the upstream URL (scheme, host and port) of
the request based on its path, its query arguments, a header, or a JWT
claim.
When combined with the APIcast policy, the routing policy should be
placed before it in the policy chain.
routing.name: Routing
routing.summary: Allows to modify the upstream URL of the request.

pattern.description: Pattern to match against the request.

description: This policy adds support for a very small subset of SOAP.
It expects a SOAP action URI in the SOAPAction header or the Content-Type
header. The SOAPAction header is used in v1.1 of the SOAP standard:
https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/#_Toc478383528 , whereas
the Content-Type header is used in v1.2 of the SOAP standard:
https://www.w3.org/TR/soap12-part2/#ActionFeature
The SOAPAction URI is matched against the mapping rules defined in the
policy and calculates a usage based on that so it can be authorized and
reported against 3scale's backend.
soap.name: SOAP
soap.summary: Adds support for a small subset of SOAP.

description: Configures a 1-1 mapping for upstream's http codes.

statuscode_overwrite.summary: Modify the HTTP status code returned by the upstream

description: This policy allows to modify the upstream URL (scheme, host and port) of the request based on its path.
It accepts regular expressions and, when matched against the request path,
replaces the upstream URL with a given string.
When combined with the APIcast policy, the upstream policy should be
placed before it in the policy chain.
upstream.name: Upstream
upstream.summary: Allows to modify the upstream URL of the request based on its path.

connect_timeout.description: Timeout for establishing a connection (in seconds).

read_timeout.description: Timeout between two successive read operations (in seconds).

send_timeout.description: Timeout between two successive write operations (in seconds).

upstream_connection.description: Allows to configure several options for the connections to the upstream

methods.description: Array of HTTP methods this rule must be applied to. If left blank it will be applied to all HTTP methods

break.description: when set to true, if the command rewrote the URL, it will be the last one applied

op.description: Operation to be applied (sub or gsub)

Substitute all the matches of the regex applied.

replace.description: String that will replace what is matched by the regex

methods.description: Array of HTTP methods this rule must be applied to. If left blank it will be applied to all HTTP methods

oneOf.title: Add a value to an existing argument
Create the arg when not set, replace its value when set
Create the arg when not set, add the value when set

description: This policy allows to modify the path of a request.
The operations supported are sub and gsub based on ngx.re.sub and
ngx.re.gsub provided by OpenResty. Please check
https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module for more details on how
to define regular expressions and learn the options supported.
When combined with the APIcast policy, if the URL rewriting policy is
placed before it in the chain, the APIcast mapping rules will apply to the
modified path. If the URL rewriting policy is placed after APIcast in the
chain, then the mapping rules will apply to the original path.
url_rewriting.name: URL Rewriting
url_rewriting.summary: Allows to modify the path of a request.

description: A policy which allows Websocket traffic for the service
websocket.name: Websocket
